answers.answer: As of July 1, 2024, the support program for Ukrainians in Romania changed to a new financial support program called the Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.

answers.answer: The new financial support program for beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania is the Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries can receive the monthly lump sum for accommodation for up to 3 consecutive months, with the period starting from their date of entry into Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania are eligible unless they are receiving international protection, residing in government-provided temporary accommodation camps, or have previously received accommodation benefits under previous regulations.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Exclusions'.

answers.answer: The standard monthly lump sum for accommodation for a single individual in Romania is 750 RON per month.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Amount'.

answers.answer: The standard monthly lump sum for accommodation for families in Romania is 2,000 RON per month.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Amount'.

answers.answer: For special cases, the monthly lump sum is 500 RON per month for individuals and 1,500 RON per month for families.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Special Cases'.

answers.answer: Required documents include a valid temporary protection permit, passports for each family member, bank account details for a Romanian bank in RON, and any other documents requested by local authorities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Required Documents'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries must submit their application to their local administrative-territorial unit (e.g., town hall), filling out the application form, providing personal details including CNP numbers, proof of temporary protection, a bank account statement, and indicating they are not residing in a temporary accommodation camp.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Application Process'.

answers.answer: The application for the first month's payment of the lump sum should be submitted within the first 5 working days of that month.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Notes'.

answers.answer: You cannot benefit from the accommodation support program if you are a Romanian citizen, reside in a university dormitory as a student, or have a work permit or student residence permit in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Exclusions for Rent Payment Support'.

answers.answer: After the monthly lump sum period ends, beneficiaries may apply for a Minimum Inclusion Income, provided in accordance with Law No. 196/2016.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Transition to Minimum Inclusion Income'.

answers.answer: Detailed information on applying for Minimum Inclusion Income can be obtained by following the links to the official websites of specific sectors or cities in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Transition to Minimum Inclusion Income'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens facing application difficulties can ask for help from Romanian/English speakers, contact NGOs with relevant language speakers, or reach out to call centers with Ukrainian-Russian-Romanian speakers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: For assistance, you can call the government call center at 021.3456789, UNHCR Romania at +40 723 653 651, or CNRR at +40 730 073 170.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Individuals needing help finding free accommodation in Romania can use the 'Un Acoperi»ô (A Roof)' platform, where central authorities and international organizations coordinate assistance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Assistance in finding housing'.
